intro: Impatiens psychadelphoides, commonly known as the psychedelic impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are spurred at the base, a distinctive feature of the genus Impatiens, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in moist, shady environments.
